Sentence: i have had this laptop a good few weeks now, tested it fully and know the positives and negatives.
it has a glossy glare which is really nice, easy to clean and good quality.
remember, black absorbs heat and makes it fade.
unfortunately i left mine in the sun and the keys have faded (that is my fault not the product) i am still looking to find a replacement, would be great if i could be directed.
left and right clickers (i made that word up) are very nice and feel like they are built with quality.
however, sometimes the mouse freezes for anywhere up to 40 seconds when opening numerous programs or running scans.
i would say it lacks a bit of performance as it should load easy tasks in seconds, it does not always respond when i ask it to and some applications fail to load as quick as they should.
intel hd graphics is an integrated graphics card that is basic but still very good.
i play a standard browser based mmo that runs at 40-45 out of 50 frames per second, for me that is very good.

it also handles some games well such as skyrim, dirt and farcry at medium graphics.audio is great, very loud and clear.webcam is very nice, perfect for streaming, very high detailed with no 'jittering.
ports are good, the hdmi works perfectly and looks great with my tv.
windows8 iseasy to use, quickly able to adapt from taking a first time leap from xp all the way to the newest os.
at first i was a bit pessimistic, but i am very happy with it is design, features and ease of use.
service and delivery was great from brandx as usual.
a very satisfied customer and i will not fail to recommend this product.
the casing on the front of the screen (trim where the webcam is) feels 'plasticy, weak and cheap, the back is ridged and a nice design though.
overall rating from me, 8/10.
some mildly rough patches but still a great system, the price is very decent for what you are getting.
i hoped it would stop after few minutes, but it didn not.
now every time i turn this laptop on, this sound bothers me, especially when i use the laptop in a quiet place.
can someone help me to fix this problem so i don not have to return it?
i use the modelx for all my computing needs, the non-touch is definitely worth the money, and that extra hundred for touch is preference.
it has common durability.
get windows 8 pro for the extra security (bitlocker), extra speed, and accessibility.
it feels like a small desktop, and ironically has more storage than my windows 7 gateway.
the on screen keyboard pops up when you don not ask it to-i didn not buy a tablet i don not need it.
doing so will break the computer.
everything will run slow and give errors and do lots of weird stuff.

the scan they have you run will come back fine after getting stuck around 98% for a long time and they try to put you off by not calling when they said and giving a super long wait time when you call back, stay on the line!
they need to replace the whole thing and extend the warranty if they are going to release updates that break the computer!-very disgruntled.
this one provided what we needed for a good price.
my laptop started experiencing scree/display problems within the first week.
it appears pixels have stopped working in a small portion of the screen.
its small but becomes extremely annoying when watching a movie or trying to do work and there is a small blotch in the middle of someone is face.
pros:works well,fast cons: manufacturer defect.
you get what you pay for and this is not an expensive machine.
windows 8.1 can only be downoaded by removing an installed update.
wanted to upgrade the one i had used for a few days and return the one i had not even opened but due to only 7 day return period brandx refuse to have either of them back.
i have 2 expensive bookends.
bought the modelx to replace ~10 year old brandx desktop - had not realized the prices for laptops had reached such levels.
only a month in, but quite pleased from an overall perspective.
maybe not as fast or feature rich as higher priced laptops/desktops, but suits our purpose as a basic machine.
excellent price/performance ratio

my frist modelx window vista i had it for 10 yrs with out know problems , so my son got us this insp.. 15 when i told him it was the best pc i ever had , he got him one an in 2 yrs he got us this one an sent us his love as he love the brandx perfromice , an that how we got are new pc .. from the hard working brandx pc lap tops .../ thank you brandx for the fine pcs you offer us
this laptop is much lighter than my last one.
i have had no problems so far but have always found that customer service with brandx was so easy to access.
this has everything that i need and at a decent price.
i think that this computer is fun to use and easy to use pros:so easy to learn to use, light weight
it is a very good entry level non-touch laptop for people who only use it for email, homework, and web browsing.
it is design is clean and easy for people who prefer traditional tower pcs.
pros:ease of use cons:no cd/dvd-r, memory stuck at 4gb max.
this may make a great computer for a high school student, or a college student, but not for someone who does not want a loud clicking sound from the touch pad disrupting meetings.
other than that, it is not a bad buy.
it is my third brandx purchase, and probably my last.
this is perfect laptop for everyday use.
i got this for my mom, she knows enough to get the job done.
windows 8 has a little learning curve but it is nice.
computer is great for schooling and gaming at an affordable price.
cannot beat the deal on this lap top.
glad i made the purchase.
this laptop makes the high-pitched noises from beneath the keyboard.
with a full hd screen and haswell, this ultrabook combines great visuals with better performance and battery life.
the build quality and design are unrivaled.
will never buy another brandx again.
cons:screen bleeding, loose track pad.
i have had several brandx desktops and a couple laptops over the years.
all have been very good.

my last brandx was the xps 14 ultrabook and it was very good except i had some overheating problems, yet i had bought it as a "refurbished" from the brandx outlet, knowing chances you take with such purchases.
like i said, other then that the xps14 computer was very good, but i decided to sell it and try one more time with a brandx product, even though i had it repaired by brandx......
the good news????
it took nearly three weeks to get my order but it was worth the wait and suspense.
this new xps 13 computer rocks!!!!!
it really is the perfect computer i have dreamed about for years.
computer is lightweight, incredibly mobile, fast, stylish, i could on and on.....you will not be disappointed.
even the old windows 7 seemed new and improved the way it ran on this system.
i am a very happy customer and i think brandx has hit a new bulls eye with this one.
all they need to do is get the word out.
this is my fifth and it is fantastic.
this is the perfect ultra book out there.
brandx has always made excellent computers.
the brandx xps 13 is great.
this pc boots up in just seconds and it is extremely quiet.
perfect for students although it is pretty pricey however this pc excels in everything and it is well worth it.
i highly recommend this pc to everyone.
the brandx xps 13 is the perfect ultra book.
i am a long time brandx user, and this modelx 3521 laptop is the tenth brandx i have brought home.
my daughter is older laptop finally gave up the ghost--after six grueling years of college--so i replaced it with this honey.

it does everything she would want it to do for schoolwork, and then some--surfing the web, writing papers, listening to music, streaming videos, using skype, and considerably faster than her older model.
keep up the good work, brandx.
you haven not disappointed us yet!
(hide) pros:great price, lightweight, lots of features, windows 7.
i have been using the laptop daily, it is fast and extremely easy to use and get accustomed to.
i have a desktop and pad but was looking for something that i could use when i travel and sitting at home and playing games while watching tv but i did not want to spend a lot of money.
my new modelx fits the bill.
while it is a bit unwieldy to use the start up function and the wires needed, once it is up and running, it is nice and fast.
email, browsing the internet, etc.
we have had it just over 2 weeks now and have not found a thing we do not like.
this is probably the 5th laptop i have bought from brandx in the last 3 years.
this is the first windows 8 laptop that i bought that i like.
i like the size, it is lightweight, pretty fast on start up and connecting to web pages.
this is my first laptop so i need to get used to the keyboard.
i feel this is a great product for the cost.
solid computer except for the screen which cracked after 6 months of use when opening the computer.
also, something was wrong with the original set up-did not configure admin account and the disk drive wouldn not work.
had to call cust.
took a long time, but they did a great job and it works well now.
pros:faster than my old vista.
for a mid-range business laptop, or for most personal use, this is definitely a good quality laptop.
the case feels quite a lot more durable than the less expensive options, has great access to all ports, and runs very quietly.
a laptop that can actually work both as a laptop or as a desktop replacement solution so well is rare.
the keyboard has also been extremely easy to get used to, compared to many other laptop keyboards out there.
i’ve owned several desktops over the years and this was my very first laptop purchase.

i was looking for a simple basic machine that i could take with me to check e-mail, find restaurants/attractions on vacation or watch a movie or play a basic game on the airplane (it’s not a “gaming” machine).
however, this little laptop has excelled in all of these plus some more.
i’ve installed ms office and some photo editing software and it performs just fine using these.
the 500gb is plenty big enough for anything i’m doing.
it’s really thin and lightweight, around 5 pounds.
the battery life is also pretty darn good.
i get about 4 hours of operation out of it watching a couple of movies or general working.
it also has 4 usb ports (two 2.0 and two 3.0) and an hdmi port which i thought was kinda cool.
the only con i have is that i wish it had come with windows 7 since it’s not a touch screen.
overall i think it’s one of the best, if not the best, values for a basic laptop which has several additional nice features.
bought this for my wife to replace an emachine celeron box.
happy with the overall purchase and experience.
in the spirit of honesty, i am a brandx services employee and with the discounted price and my employee discount, it was a very good purchase.
wife had enough issues moving from xp to win 7 a few years back so i knew i did not want to try to take her to win 8.
running it on a brandx 22" monitor thru the adapter.
i simply love this computer.
it was my first one with a touch screen and it was very simple to set-up and begin using.
it would have saved me time overall.
i would recommend this system to anyone for a really good all around daily use computer.
pros:easy to use, fast and efficient, inexpensive, versitile cons:too many preloaded apps, no app tutorial on desktop.
my previous one lastest 3 years, so decided to take the plunge again and it was well worth it.
the laptop is much faster than my previous one, there is barely any sound or heat.
the graphics are clear, and it doesnt seem to bogged down with brandx software like my last one did.
the number pad isnt really useful to me, and would much rather have a fuller keyboard but it doesnt bother me and i am sure some will find it useful.

windows 8 is a bit scary at first, but its actually a great operating system and is well worth having once you get used to it - makes the whole thing more fluid and personal once you pin and move all your apps.
i use the modelx for all my computing needs, the non-touch is definitely worth the money, and that extra hundred for touch is preference.
it has common durability.
get windows 8 pro for the extra security (bitlocker), extra speed, and accessibility.
it feels like a small desktop, and ironically has more storage than my windows 7 gateway.
this may make a great computer for a high school student, or a college student, but not for someone who does not want a loud clicking sound from the touch pad disrupting meetings.
other than that, it is not a bad buy.
it is my third brandx purchase, and probably my last.
it not widi ready so if you are planning to use it with you hdtv or smart tv don not bother.
it dose not have intel widi.
this pc is responsive, fast, and easy-to-use.
i was skeptical of the windows 8 operating system, but it is very nice.
my fault that i didn not understand no dvd/dvr writer but other than that very happy with what i got for what i paid
i thought i reviewed this product thoroughly before purchasing, but this one got past me.
i came back online, today, to see if the part was missing, and that is when i realized the darn thing is optional.
then, when i clicked to choose one, i was taken to a goofy page that explained how to choose one, only.
i searched all dvd drives (don not want a cd type), but got tired of clicking to see that this model was not listed.
you know that annoying floating-popup asking if you want to chat?
i clicked it just to read that chat is not available, try later.
the power supply plugs into the left rear side of the laptop instead of the back.
there are 4 usb ports with 1 being exactly where the mouse pad and mouse are located.
i got it at a good price, but am not happy.
i do love the performance and wanted windows 7 os instead of windows 8.
this was a wise purchase, a good value, easy to get used to,and performs well.
it also arrived several days ahead of schedule.
i recently purchased a new laptop, the modelx.
it seemed intuitive to me that i should order windows 8.
isn not it obvious that it would be better than the previous version?
i hate that operating system.
i wanted a computer not a large app device.
and it turns out the new computer is much heavier.
so after much hemming and hawing decided to return it.
yes i know i should have checked that, but there was the whole holiday travel thing in there as well.
so alas, i have a heavy laptop with an obnoxious operating system that we don not want.
it has all the basic feature you need.
if i could i would return this laptop today for something that performs at a reasonable speed as a 6 time brandx computer owner this is the worst by far...
the windows 8 operating system is designed for social media, but not for business applications.
if you desire a toy, this computer will meet your needs.
it does not function with serious business software, and is almost impossible to upgrade to windows 7 professional.
do not buy brandx laptop as part quality is not good and get failed soon and upon it extended warranty package cost too much..
but then putting up with windows 8 has been a night mare.
i want to throught this laptop at the wall.
having problem staying online, constantly timing out.
i have three other devices and none of them have this problem.
t is pretty slow but it works.
cannot install windows video editor because it doesn not meet minimum machine requirements.
first time with windows 8 and hate it.
websites take a while to load and seems delayed.
may be returning this laptop.
product is good for the money.
however not a fan of "chicklet" keyboard which feels light and very cheaply made.
they really should be in the back, otherwise you end up with wires coming out of sides of laptop and hindering viable desk space on sides of the laptop
very inconvenient to type on, but good to watch some online shows where space is limited.
overall not too bad, but the mousepad is a nightmare.
received my new laptop today and it is brilliant!!
windows 8 has taken a bit of getting use to but easy to pick up.
excellent laptop for a great price only problem is that the buttons on the mouse pad are loud when you press them but that is not such a big problem.
i would recommend this product!
great computer!
i needed a basic laptop to handle my business needs and maybe a little personal stuff as well from time to time.
i am having a little bit of an issue with the touch pad.
the other problem with it is the black trim around the keypad is trash.
though not brandx is problem windows 8 has frozen up on me several times and most of the problem there is because of ie 10.
i hate it and use chrome now.
overall the laptop so far is doing the basic job i need it for and that is to handle sales, inventory, and email.
i would not recommend this for a power user or someone who wants to do heavy internet usage.
also the power cable plugs in on the left side.
this is very misleading and there is no-where visible to actually add this feature as a 'paid extra'.
i took 'optional' as meaning you either have it switched on or off.
have tried ringing brandx today, on phone for 38 minutes, transferred at least 9 times to different assistants and after repeating myself each time, gave up.
feel a bit disappointed.

i had been running a 5/6 year old modelx20 into the ground - it was so broken that i had the lid gorilla-glued to box lid hinges to keep it open - so my requirements for a new laptop weren not super high just to give you a frame of reference.
i got the i3-3227u version and this little bugger seems pretty nice for the price for me.
seems pretty fast for just about everything i need - a little web development as well as common usage.
i am a casual gamer, but i am usually playing stuff about 3-5 years behind its release, and this thing is pretty much smoking for that.
fallout 3 is running nicely on high settings.
the intel hd 4000 card did not disappoint (for me as a behind-the-times gamer).

and i have had it on my lap while playing and not gotten any lapburn or even felt much of a temperature rise
gripes are that the keyboard will need some getting used to - the arrow keys are pretty small and home, delete, etc are also.
i thought i wasn not going to loveit much but i absolutely love it.
it is efficient and works well, everything seems organized and my internet or my wifi are both working great with speed.
still learning new things about it but i love it.
it is a lot more manageable than i thought it would be.
i have brought this laptop on 12/04/2013 from the brandx exclusive store.
its an awesome laptop but its cpu is not so powerful.
i love using this computer for everything.
i have bought this laptop for working with office programs, adobe indesign, photoshop and other programs.
also for internet and other light tasks.
i have always been a brandx customer and thought that was a good thing, but i find it difficult to understand how 2 of the same laptops could be so different.
one has worked well since i got it and the other purchased at the same time has been nothing but problems.
it has run very hot since i bought it and now it is at the point that it just continues to power off with limited use.
the other one continues to work ok.
i have the cheap model of modelx 3521.
after i installed the newest drivers very satisfied with it, it is a good machine for the price.
if you have not much money and aren not a gamer, i can recommend this notebook for you.
i been a brandx lap top user for the past 7 years and i love it and all the support i get from brandx!!
had a small problem with the shutdown button under the charms.
luckily i only had the computer for a week and no major things saved to the computer after that everything works.
surprisingly quick startup for a relatively inexpensive laptop.
decent graphics.
it is very quick in opening programs and such.
it has two usb 3.0 ports, which is a great thing for a laptop this inexpensive.
the other is the fact that it doesn not come with recovery media.
other than those two things, this is a great machine and well worth the money.
it is not for high end games and graphics intensive things, but it is great for what it is designed for.
i bought this computer for my nephew for school.
very nice platform for windows 8.
overall it is a nice computer for a budget price.
purchased this on line direct from brandx.
it shipped very quickly and arrived in good shape.
i was easy to immediately begin using it.
this laptop was no exception.
it is a good, steady machine.
the side connection are not the best way, prefer rear connections.
this is my second brandx laptop and so far i am very happy with this one.
overall, i think it is a great laptop and it suits my needs perfectly.
i would not trust another brandx but brandx.
the product is good for everyday use.
the speed is okay for everyday.
the touch pad is working alright although it has that oily look very fast once you start using it.
i have used computers since the timex zx80 and can say it is a great laptop.
the only drawback is the textured surface which shows hand prints wherever it is touched.
the third edition cpu is fast enough for a laptop, will we ever be satisfied with the speed, no matter how fast.
i am no stranger to brandx as this is our 3rd laptop direct from them.
our last brandx studio is still going strong, but i needed something with a little more punch for testing out component designs at home.
windows 8 is a peculiar one at first, but i sat down and went through the instructions 'getting started with windows 8 on your new brandx' that are provided.
it is good that brandx had the forethought to include this and now i think windows 8 is superb!

the keyboard is a pleasure to use and the keys soft but still definite in operation, with the annoying gaps between closed off, saving the inevitable collection of biscuit crumbs that cause malfunction.
operating wise, it is fast to wake up, though i have yet to find a quick way to sleep - i am sure it will be there somewhere and i just need to find it.
it is nice and fast to open programs and not found anything it couldn not cope with doing.
the only thing i really don not like is that the plastic trim around the case just feels a little bit too cheap & nasty.
time over again, i would pay a bit more and get the metal trimmed option, but the same spec 15r wasn not available until the end of jan 2014.
i use it as a back-up and sync it to my alienware desktop and take it on the road with me.
it is a great machine.
easy start up / set up.
just needed a laptop for some low maintenance stuff on the go.
purchased esp.
thankfully, brandx understands that windows 8 is not right for everybody.
i tell everyone to shop brandx first.
this is one great laptop and a great deal.
i see allot of reviews saying haw bad windows 8 but it just takes a little getting use to, once you know how to use the feature it has it works great.
i ordered this computer and i just love it.
was very skeptical of purchasing a computer with widows 8 because i had heard terrible things about it.
computer is very user friendly and i have become very comfortable with using it.
i would highly recommend this computer to others.
have had no problems....love the machine!

i have had my new laptop a couple of months and i am very happy with my purchase.takes a little getting used to the new windows 8,not bad just different.i woul highly recommend brandx laptops and desktops as well.nothing but top of the line products.
i hoped it would stop after few minutes, but it didn not.
now every time i turn this laptop on, this sound bothers me, especially when i use the laptop in a quiet place.
can someone help me to fix this problem so i don not have to return it?
i got the modelx back in march 2013 a few months after it came out and have had it now for about eight months.
it is a really nice computer.
it is the most thin and lightweight computer i have ever had.
windows 8 took a while to figure out but eventually you get used to it.

i also had an issue with it always showing fingerprints on the outside and on the mouse pad every time someone touched the laptop when it was new, but i don not really notice anymore the longer i have had it.
it is packed full of features.
i got it for a reasonable price with a discount.
after having the modelx, it is the exact same thing as more expensive and popular laptop brandxs except way cheaper and very affordable.
i definitely don not regret purchasing this laptop and would buy it again any day.
given this laptop for my birthday and exceedingly pleased, windows 8 is fantastic as i gives you the option to go to normal view and the new layout.

the laptop itself is excellent, having used my old brandx desktop for the last 10 years, couldn not have hoped for a better laptop
nice for me to use as a student as i can do everything that i want to do and for my mum who uses it as well, so good to use for all people as you can do a variety of things.
only thing i would say is that the charge does not last for 7 hours on the go, but other than that fantastic, nice to be able to do tings quickly rather than wait an age to get anything done.
many weeks of watching deals pass me by of touchscreen laptops.
i didn not want to spend lot (didn not need financing).
i chose the modelx.
i ordered on monday 3/11 and arrived 3/14, now that is fast delivery.
i am attaching some pictures of what is not so great and maybe not a big deal, but i have only used it for 3 days and fingerprints on the touch pad and the outside cover show!
other than the fingerprints (yes i always wash my hands before i use the laptop), the laptop speed is great.
is the outside cover replaceable (to something that doesn not show a lot of fingerprints)?
it is easy to download from the store.

all are still working
great.
i called brandx up, and less than 2 minutes, brandx had to update drivers and i was up and running again.

at that time, i had so many question with this new system, amy at brandx was more than happy to help me resolve all
of my questions.
brandx stands behind their products, and they have always helped me resolve any issue.
i am so glad i have this new modelx to work with!

when i was shopping for a laptop i was going to get the cheapes one i could find, but then said to myself why get one that would only last for a little bit then i would have to go and buy anotherone anyway.
i have had other brandx stuff before, so i know that the price i paid is well worth it.
soon i am going to get me another laptop hear soon and its going to be a brandx to.
i have told a few of my friends about it and thay to are going to get a brandx also.
i am very pleased with this product, it works great with surfing the web, light gaming and watching videos.
it is very good,i use it every day and it is very usefull to me.
i am a highschool student, and i was looking to purchase a laptop that was quicker to make school work easier.
this laptop is great not only for school work, but every other type of daily use.
one great feature is the start up time, which takes under a minute.
i get over 4 hours on light usage.
the track pad on mine is very responsive, and the keyboard is well built and easy to type on.
another complaint was windows 8. personally, i think it is a huge improvement from windows 7. it is much easier to personalize and to use.
overall this laptop is a great bargain.
it is well built (the fact that it is plastic isn not an issue - it is very sturdy and the texture is nice for repelling fingerprints), and works perfectly.
i have the i3 3rd gen. with 6gb of ram.
i read other reviews, i have no clue what others are talking about, my computer boots up exceptionally quick.
they are standing strong.
i did a lot of research before buying the modelx from brandx.
as well, buying from a reputable source sealed the deal.
it is a great machine.
this is a great item and has wonderful features.
i would recommend this product to anyone
affordable computer, excellent performance..great for college kids.
i bought this laptop as a gift for someone and they loved it, it works really good.
hey it is not perfect, but you cannot beat the overall performance for the price.
great laptop overall.
this is one great laptop and a great deal.
i see allot of reviews saying haw bad windows 8 but it just takes a little getting use to, once you know how to use the feature it has it works great.
i recommend any brandx product to anybody !!!!!!!!
we own several brandx laptops and never had any grief on buying any of them.
enjoying my new laptop.
have had no problems....love the machine!
this pc has great features and i ues it for everything
first off, i want to say i have the ipad mini, ipad 2, the nook hd, and the kindle fire hd.
all very impressive tablets.
after weeks of research, i had my eye on the sony tap 11, microsoft surface 2, microsoft surface pro 2, acer w4, and the lenovo miix2.
i have experimented with other tablets including the surfaces and found a strong interest in their performance but i couldn not agree with the prices and the strip down version of windows 8.
then i found this little gem.
a tablet with powerful hardware, a full windows 8.1 os, and a price nearly impossible to beat.
the reviews seemed to rate this tablet 4.5/5 i was convinced.
after receiving the product, i fell in love with the performance as well as the speed, capabilities, and execution of the tablet.
i seriously recommend this tablet.
i am a technical professional  haveteran' (which just means old) of the semiconductor industry.
i have long been searching for a single, very mobile device that allows to travel light, yet effectively be capable when needed.
(my company is a ms based enterprise).
will not be redundant here with detail, performance - excellent, surprisingly so.
i run full office365, some sharepoint apps and an old version of paperport.
the dual band wifi has so far exceeded any other mobile device i have owned.
one exception and this one of only 2 minor misses.
miracast for display is problematic(but works..with effort) knew this going in, but a mini-hdmi would make this an amazing tool for a traveling professional.
if you are looking for a similar stylus experience to the 'note' then this isn not for you if it is critical.
very 'marginal' for handwritten notes in 'onenote'.
i use it for the handwriting input panel in win8.1 and works fine for this.
personal use : excellent.
note: i would recommend only 64gb model!
i made a mistake on my first one and ended up with 32gb (wife has this now) :) in my opinion, 32gb should not be sold.
you max out the memory in a heart beat, especially if you are using business apps.

5gb 1080p mkv files with pass through dts audio play flawless in vlc.i give value 5 for 5 despite the 2 minor misses as i consider those my 'quest for the ultimate portable' and it is hard to knock considering the price-point and value.
if this device had a mini-hdmi so i could use to present ppt and a smoother stylus for hand-writing notes on par with wacomm...this would be the device i have always searched for.
but hey, for the money amazing value/performance and quality.
nice job brandx.
pros:screen, performance, mobility, battery, quality of build cons:stylus - 'jittery' but sensitive, no mini-hdmi.
